text: <@U0KPFAZNF>: <@U0MT4CBHB> Agree that Chaincode events E have to play by the same rules as state data S. And this goes not only for persistence but also security treatment. Other “system” events such as block events can be treated differently.
are there block events too? what are they and for what ?
a “block” event is sent out when a block is committed successfully. Equivalent to user polling for the block
